intro: Candollea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy candollea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Candollea hirsuta is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions.
